tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“If at first the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it“

-Albert Einstein       

“Growth Hacking is more of a mindset, than a toolkit “

– Aaron Ginn

PayPal, on the brink of shutdown, recuperated and increased their customer base to tens of millions through one single growth hack. Want to learn how?

Growth Hacking is a marketing technique developed by technology startups which use creative techniques and social metrics to sell products and gain exposure.

Growth hackers focus on low-cost and innovative alternatives to traditional marketing, like utilizing social media and viral marketing. It also involves making an optimization to a product in order to improve marketing i.e the product markets itself.

A growth hacker is someone who should have an in depth understanding about the product (the technical aspects of it) as well as the recent market trends and ideologies. Do you have crazy start-up ideas and want to know how to market them most effectively? Learn from the professionals in digital and product marketing. Sign right up!

tabs.title: Guest Profile
tabs.content:
Hrishikesh Kunte

Having founded Slingshoot, a co-founder of Dance with Madhuri, an ex-employee at Quikr and current Product and Digital Marketing manager at Zomato, he is well known across India for his command over digital marketing practices and customer insight. He is known to have a keen interest in Business Digital Marketing with expertise in Display, SEM, Ad networks and an in-depth understanding of internet and mobile advertising. He is also well versed in internet analytics such as Google analytics, bucketing, funneling etc. He was also called upon to talk at the 24adp digital marketing conference conducted in Pune this year.

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1

Session 1 (8.30 AM – 12.30 PM)

» Introduction

» Introduction to Growth Hacking

» Case study on many major companies that did successful growth hacks.

» Use case study to explain on how to think like a growth hacker

» Different tactics in Growth Hacking

  • Push tactics
  • Pull tactics
  • Funnel etc.

» Different metrics involved in growth hacking analysis

  • KPI (Key performance Indicator)
  • LTV ( live time value of customer)
  • Segments
  • Viral coefficient
  • Cohorts
  • Customer acquisition cost
  • Multivariate testing etc.

» Give a product of a particular company and its requirements and criteria, the people attending the workshop must think of growth hacks that could make the product better.

Session 2 (1.30 PM – 5.00 PM)

The Essentials

» The participants will convey their ideas of growth hacks for the product given, which is then compared with the actual growth hack performed by the company for that product.

» Product optimization

» Improving product and product lifecycle management

» Early traction

» Fast growth

» Digital marketing

» Offline marketing

» Different point of views on product development (Business point of view, market point of view, analytical point of view, design point of view etc.)

» Content management

» Automation

» How to channel the users to make them do what you want

» How to retain users

» Examples of various mini hacks

» Introduction to SEO (AEO in terms of apps)

» Finding good partners to sponsor your product

» Deals and discounts

» Introduction to various tools and terminologies used.

» Analysis and types of analysis

  • General analytics
  • People/event based analytics
  • Niche analytics
  • Custom analytics

» Conclusion

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Eligibility Criterion:

Students having valid IDs from any recognized educational institution can attend this workshop.

» Pre-requisites:

There are no pre-requisites for this workshop. This can be attended by anyone who is interested in marketing and related fields.

» Type of Participation:

Participants have to register individually for this workshop.      

» Payment:

The cost of the workshop is ₹500 per head and the payment details will be mailed to the shortlisted participants.

» Certificate Criterion:

The certificate will be issued to the participant only if he/she attends all the sessions of the workshop. Failing to do so, the registration of the participant will stand for the cancellation and he/she will have to forfeit the fee.

tabs.title: FAQ
tabs.content:
» Do I need previous experience in Marketing / Growth Hacking?

No. The workshop takes care of all the relevant details regarding growth hacking and marketing strategies from scratch.

» What do I gain from this workshop?

You get to learn about what growth hacking is, how different companies have modeled their success due to simple yet efficient growth hacks and the various techniques used in growth hacking.

» Will I be provided with a certificate?

Yes, but we request you to participate for your own interest and not for a certificate.

» Should I bring any material for this workshop?

You must bring your College ID card. If you are required to bring anything else, we would inform you through mail after your registration.

» Do you provide accommodation?

Yes. The short listed candidates will be provided accommodation based on the availability and nativity. Participants have to separately register and pay for the accommodation. Participants will be notified of the registrations for accommodation.
